info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 8:49AM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT CST FRIDAY NIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Bon Homme County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 3 PM this afternoon to midnight CST Friday night. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible by Friday afternoon. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
